treatment.description: Leaves ascending to spreading, blades 30–70 × 8–36 mm, bases attenuate to cuneate, clasping (more so in distal leaves), apices acute to attenuate; cauline ± sessile, reduced distally. Disc florets: corollas 5.8–7.6 mm, lobes 1–1.6 mm; anthers yellow, ca. 2.6 mm; style branches 1.8–2.5 mm, stigmatic lines nearly as long as appendages, appendages 1.2–1.7 mm. Cypselae 4–5 mm; pappi 6–7 mm. 2n = 18.
treatment.habitat: rocky terrain near and above treeline
treatment.discussion: Toiyabea alpina is found in the Toiyabea and Toquima mountains of southern Nevada.
